Key functionalities sought in the proposed tools include; precise scanning control, Operate at extremely low temperatures, be prepared to be an ultrahigh vacuum tool.
description: This challenge aims to create an instrument for atomically precise manufacturing, consisting of a hybrid fabrication tool and microscope developed around a linear, open loop scanner, capable of building quantum circuit components with minimal error and without the strict limitations of currently available equipment. This instrument, together with other capabilities in the system for testing and packaging, will also allow for atomic circuit prototypes to be shipped to other partners.

## Government Tender Announcement
### Fabrication System for Atom-Scale Quantum Devices
#### Reference Number: PW-23-01024934
#### Solicitation Number: EN578-20ISC3

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) under the Innovative Solutions Canada (ISC) program, specifically Call for Proposals 003 (EN578-20ISC3).

#### Tender Description
The ISC is seeking a fabrication system that enables the creation of atom-scale quantum devices. This system should be capable of accurately creating single atom quantum dots and spin centers on a silicon surface. The ISC is interested in a device that can operate at 4 K temperature, maintain a stable tunnel current of at least 1 pA, and achieve ultrahigh vacuum.

#### Desired Outcomes
The proposed solution must meet the following essential criteria:

1.  Demonstrate atom-resolution images of silicon (100) in both Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM) and Qplus Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM).
2.  Provide a linear scanner operating in open loop.
3.  Operate at 4 K temperature for sample and scanner.
4.  Demonstrate a stable, measurable tunnel current at least as low as 1 pA.
5.  Be prepared as an ultrahigh vacuum tool.
6.  Have separate vacuum systems for atomic fabrication, silicon preparation, and tip fabrication.
7.  Achieve ultrahigh vacuum ~ 1e-10 Torr for all vacuum systems.
8.  Meet additional criteria, such as no measurable creep and hysteresis under normal scanning speeds and over the full range of motion.

#### Tender Evaluation
Proposals will be evaluated based on their ability to meet the essential and additional criteria outlined above. The evaluation will be conducted in two phases:

1.  Phase 1: Proposals will be evaluated on their ability to meet the essential criteria.
2.  Phase 2: Short-listed proposals will be evaluated on their ability to meet the additional criteria.

#### Tender Closing Date
The tender closing date is March 29, 2023, at 14:00 EDT.

#### Contact Information
For any inquiries or clarification, please contact [TGSPC.SIC-ISC.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:TPSGC.SIC-ISC.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) no later than ten calendar days before the tender closing date.
